channel.title: This American Life
channel.description: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast. It is hosted by Ira Glass, produced in collaboration with Chicago Public Media, delivered to stations by PRX The Public Radio Exchange, and has won all of the major broadcasting awards.
channel.itunes:author: This American Life
channel.itunes:subtitle: This American Life is a weekly public radio show, heard by 2.2 million people on more than 500 stations. Another 2.5 million people download the weekly podcast.

item.title: 513: 129 Cars
item.description: We spend a month at a Jeep dealership on Long Island as they try to make their monthly sales goal: 129 cars. If they make it, they'll get a huge bonus from the manufacturer, possibly as high as $85,000 — enough to put them in the black for the month. If they don't make it, it'll be the second month in a row. So they pull out all the stops.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: One car dealership tries to sell 129 cars. It is way more chaotic than we expected.
item.itunes:summary: We spend a month at a Jeep dealership on Long Island as they try to make their monthly sales goal: 129 cars. If they make it, they'll get a huge bonus from the manufacturer, possibly as high as $85,000 — enough to put them in the black for the month. If they don't make it, it'll be the second month in a row. So they pull out all the stops.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 709: The Reprieve
item.description: Michigan has passed its Covid-19 peak, and the state has started opening up. But it’s still been intensely difficult for the staff in the ICU at Henry Ford Hospital in Detroit. We've embedded with them over the past few months, and tracked how this pandemic has changed them and their city.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: How Covid-19 has changed the nurses and doctors at one hospital in Detroit, and their city.
item.itunes:summary: Michigan has passed its Covid-19 peak, and the state has started opening up. But it’s still been intensely difficult for the staff in the ICU at Henry Ford Hospital in Detroit. We've embedded with them over the past few months, and tracked how this pandemic has changed them and their city.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 684: Burn It Down
item.description: In the wake of George Floyd’s killing, people everywhere are demanding that police departments change not just their rules, but the culture inside that leads to these deaths. But those things are notoriously hard to change. As a case study, here's the story of a fire department that gets a new boss who starts a war with his own firefighters, to change their macho, racist culture. They fight back hard.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories of people who decide the only way forward — for real change — is to burn everything to the ground.
item.itunes:summary: In the wake of George Floyd’s killing, people everywhere are demanding that police departments change not just their rules, but the culture inside that leads to these deaths. But those things are notoriously hard to change. As a case study, here's the story of a fire department that gets a new boss who starts a war with his own firefighters, to change their macho, racist culture. They fight back hard.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 708: Here, Again
item.description: An exhaustingly familiar story. Maybe it’ll have a different ending this time, but maybe not. We hear what different people said and did one weekend in reaction to the killing of George Floyd.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: We hear what different people said and did one weekend in reaction to the killing of George Floyd.
item.itunes:summary: An exhaustingly familiar story. Maybe it’ll have a different ending this time, but maybe not. We hear what different people said and did one weekend in reaction to the killing of George Floyd.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 707: We Are in the Future
item.description: In this moment of sorrow, protest, and rage in the wake of George Floyd’s death, we offer this as a break from the dreadful present: our show about Afrofuturism. It’s a way of looking at Black culture that’s fantastic and hopeful, which feels especially urgent during a time without a lot of optimism. Featuring the song "The Deep" by clppng.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: In this moment of sorrow, protest, and rage, we offer this as a break from the dreadful present: our show about Afrofuturism.
item.itunes:summary: In this moment of sorrow, protest, and rage in the wake of George Floyd’s death, we offer this as a break from the dreadful present: our show about Afrofuturism. It’s a way of looking at Black culture that’s fantastic and hopeful, which feels especially urgent during a time without a lot of optimism. Featuring the song "The Deep" by clppng.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 706: A Mess to Be Reckoned With
item.description: Lissa Yellow Bird searches for missing people. Cold cases, mostly. People no one else is looking for. It’s not her job, but a lot of Native Americans go missing and their cases remain unsolved, so families often ask Lissa for help. But then, Lissa’s own niece goes missing.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Lissa Yellow Bird searches for missing people. She's great at it. But then, her niece goes missing.
item.itunes:summary: Lissa Yellow Bird searches for missing people. Cold cases, mostly. People no one else is looking for. It’s not her job, but a lot of Native Americans go missing and their cases remain unsolved, so families often ask Lissa for help. But then, Lissa’s own niece goes missing.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 705: Time Out
item.description: While sports of all kinds have been put on pause, we bring you favorite stories from back when people were still on football fields, boxing rings, and basketball courts.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Our favorite stories from the football fields, boxing rings, and basketball courts of days past.
item.itunes:summary: While sports of all kinds have been put on pause, we bring you favorite stories from back when people were still on football fields, boxing rings, and basketball courts.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 704: Our Pulitzer-Winning Episode
item.description: Last week, our episode "The Out Crowd" won the very first Pulitzer Prize ever awarded to a radio show. This is the episode that won, with some updates on the stories. Hear what the Trump administration’s "Remain in Mexico" policy actually means, on the ground, at the Mexican border.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: What the Trump administration’s "Remain in Mexico" policy really means, on the ground, at the Mexican border.
item.itunes:summary: Last week, our episode "The Out Crowd" won the very first Pulitzer Prize ever awarded to a radio show. This is the episode that won, with some updates on the stories. Hear what the Trump administration’s "Remain in Mexico" policy actually means, on the ground, at the Mexican border.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 703: Stuck!
item.description: During a time when a lot of us feel like we are living in a holding pattern, stories of people feeling stuck.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: During a time when a lot of us feel like we are living in a holding pattern, stories of people feeling stuck.
item.itunes:summary: During a time when a lot of us feel like we are living in a holding pattern, stories of people feeling stuck.
item.dc:creator: This American Life

item.title: 702: One Last Thing Before I Go
item.description: Words can seem so puny and ineffective sometimes. On this show, we have stories in which ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones, using a combination of small talk and not-so-small talk.
item.itunes:author: This American Life
item.itunes:subtitle: Ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones.
item.itunes:summary: Words can seem so puny and ineffective sometimes. On this show, we have stories in which ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones, using a combination of small talk and not-so-small talk.
